comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Very nice shot and Joe does look happy to pose for the occasion.  If my memory serves me right that is a "Rail Car" beside Joe, the difference was that the motor  was built into the passenger carriage and was not a detachable power unit like the big powerful diesels or steam engines that could pull passenger or goods trains.

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: Photos of Monaghan are quite uncommon, even though it was a big station. The AEC engined diesel railcar has already passed to CIE with the abolition of the Great Northern Railway in 1958, and to distinguish between CIE's and the former GNR units they added the letters G and N at either end of the railcar number as with 'G609N'. That tour travelled over the Irish North West route as fairwell to the railway before its complete closure.

comment.author: 44490546@N05
comment._content: prefix added was C not G. The railway to Monaghan closed 31st December that year and this was the last passenger train to use it. It officially closed to passengers 13.10.1957 but periodic specials such as GAA trains continued to operate Thanks for posting a rare photo
